reviews.review_msg: Avoid this class if you can - the professor relies heavily on the textbook and quizzes/exams don't align well. However, unstuckstudy ai and other study tools like ChatGPT helped me stay on top of the heavy workload. Overall, a tough course but manageable with the right resources.

Be prepared for a textbook-heavy class with minimal lecture content. The exams and assignments focus heavily on the textbook, so staying on top of the readings is crucial. Expect a challenging course with frequent quizzes and exams.
Avoid his class for psyc 100 because I felt that he did not really teach the material in lectures and just wanted us to memorize the textbook for exams.

Nice and so funny ... but his class is not marked on par with other intro first year classes, and his TAs mark in-class assignment harshly and there isn't a lot of feedback. If you read the chapters and memorize the little details (because that one little idea WILL be on the exam!) you will be fine. Also, don't bother watching the videos.

as long as you read the textbook, take notes, and understand what you just read and took notes on -- you're set. i suggest attending his in-person lectures because they can be helpful and he tells you what to focus on. recorded lectures aren't needed to do well. the TAs that mark the written assignments can be hard markers! [fall 2021]

reading the textbook and taking notes go a long way in this course. i encourage attending his in-person lectures; they can be helpful and he tells you what to focus on. recorded lectures aren't needed to do well. the TAs that mark the written assignments can be hard markers! exact same format as psyc 100, just different content. [spring 2022]
assignments were hard for no reason, and there were lots of them

I took both 100+102 with prof Day. He was definitely one of the best profs I have had. He has lots of options to earn a good grade ( through quizzes , tests , and in class writes ) and everything is pulled straight from the textbook. You just have to spend 2 hours doing the reading a week at most, and you will be good :)

Day's recorded lectures are pretty dry but informative and get points across. But his in-person lectures are more hit or miss since he expects the heavy lifting to be done by his recorded ones. 

His tests, assignments and quizzes are challenging but mostly fair since they pull from the textbook.

Exams were fair, be prepared to read the textbook & memorize every small detail. No need to go to lectures or watch his videos. Marks depend on the TA for writing assessments but they marked harshly with little feedback & never replied to any of my emails. Also he gives very confusing topics for the writing assessments so it dropped everyone's mark

Professor Day's class is nearly impossible to get a good mark in. All assessments have had a average of 50%-60%. He assigns around 2-3 chapters per unit exam and finds the smallest details to put on them. If you want a good mark in this class you need to put at least 2-3 hours a day into studying for it

In the fall and spring terms of 2022 Dr. Day did his class as a flipped course, meaning the lectures were online for you to watch on your own and then you came to class for assessments and question . He has received comments like this " He never taught anything in lectures, just made us read the textbook" are from students who didn't listen.

Honestly, exams are quite fair as long as you literally read everything in the text. Its hard to get a high mark on weekly quizzes considering theres only 12 questions, and you cant go back and change your answers. The hardest part were the in class essays, as you only have 30 minutes to write it, but the TAs mark as if you had 3 hours.

He is not HORRIBLE, however, I def don't think he has 100 level expectations. The class consisted of 8 iclicker quizzes, 4 exams, and 4 written assignments. He never taught anything in lectures, just made us read the textbook and expected us to know it like the back of our hand. He basically ran the class like an online one. I dont recommend him !
Definitely a class where you need to put in effort. Hard to get high marks on quizzes. Doesnt teach during lectures. TAs mark super hard. Doesnt feel like a 100 level course.

Honestly, if you do the readings weekly that are around 30 pages, take notes and understand the big ideas youll be fine. He drops the lowest exam scores, the only difficult part was the written assignments that the TAs marked extremely hard for a 100 level class.
Had him for both 100 and 102 and if you are completely new to psyc (even tho this is supposed to be an intro course) and a 1st yr who doesn't already have good study habits this will be a struggle.

very textbook heavy and he doesn't teach and the assignments are based all on the textbook. quizzes and exams are based on the textbook but worded very confusing and answers are very similar in wording.

Did not teach in our lectures, the only reason we were there was to take tests. The textbook chapters were very long and boring at times, so it would have helped to be taught in class. He seems like a nice person, but not the best prof.
Weekly quizzes and biweekly exams and writing assignments are terrible. Dude does q and a on emails instead of teaching. Your time will revolve around this class if you want to get a good grade.

Seems like a great guy, but he doesn't teach during lectures. Pretty interesting material sometimes, but lots of reading and memorizing to do all on your own. Lots of quizzes and a couple exams, but the in person writing assignments were the worst. Was excited for this class but only ended up happy that I didn't choose to major in psychology.
So much reading, and he barely teaches. The quizzes dont prepare you for the exams. The chapters are long and boring. Tough course in my opinion.

bro this class is making me re think being a psychology major. Great start from psyc100 failing almost everything because he doesnt teach! maybe with a lot of self teaching you can get a good mark but not doable when you have other classes too. Not worth it if you dont like reading or memorizing the whole the whole damn textbook bruh

I absolutely hate this class! I thought it was going to be a pretty easy and fun class but its the complete opposite. His marking is so hard and the averages for all assignments, exams and quizzes have been just passing so far and we have a month left! I do not recommend this class to anyone unless you want your life to revolve around it!!!

I took PSYC100 with Dr Day as an elective; If you're not committed to reading 30-40 pages a week, You will have a very hard time surviving as there are weekly quizzes/bi-weekly exams. He doesn't teach during his lectures, so the whole course is pretty much self taught which is super disappointing. Overall very difficult for an intro psych course :/

This guy does not teach, going to lectures is a waste of time and all the work is textbook based. Quizzes every week, exams and timed in-class writing assignments biweekly. Literally cannot catch a break. He gets upset when you don't show up to lectures but he doesn't do anything anyways lol. Don't take this class with him hehe.

Literally ruined my life. tricked into taking this class as I thought it was an intro/first year psyc class. weekly quizzes, so much reading, biweekly exams and timed in class-essay writes, also a couple difficult/time consuming assignments. Literally terrible despite my best efforts. should not be a level100 course only worth 3 credits. horrible

This course definitely does not feel like a level 100 course. Although he drops 2 quizzes, 1 test, and 1 assignment, you are basically learning solely through the textbook. Lectures mostly consist of q&a and they do not really go over the content of the course. Lecture times will also be mainly test or quiz time. Would not recommend this prof.

Honestly, this is supposed to be a 100 class. The difficult resembles a 300 course. He isnt generous with the markings, doesnt teach in class (you watch lecture videos instead) and doesnt give you enough information for assignments. Dont take this class for a good mark.

I got good vibes from Russell! Obviously a class with 400 people is not very personal and you do basically teach yourself from the textbook, but the quizzes/tests/assignments are very reasonable and I had a good experience in this class.

Dr. Day had short 30 minute lectures online, which were non-mandatory, but he gave previews about what we would be learning. Tests and quizzes were fair as long as you take time to read the textbook. We had open-book assessments, and he removed a test and two quizzes if you did poorly! But he definitely has a higher grading scale.

I've taken both Psych 100 and 102 from him, both online, and they were my favourite classes both semesters. Professor Day's class, even though very textbook heavy, was a lot of fun. Online we had class meetings to ask our questions twice a week and all of the lectures were pre-recorded. Overall amazing prof, 10/10 would take again!

Dr. Day is a very caring prof as he grades 6/8 quizzes and 3/4 exams. He understands that students are struggling with the online environment and he is very accommodating. I can't think of an issue with Dr. Day as his TA selection is good as well as his quizzes as they are based off the book. His lectures can be dry at times though.

As long as you review the textbook heavily and understand the big ideas from just skimming through lectures youll do great! He is willing to omit 1 major test and a few quizzes and his test are not cumulative. Attending lectures are a choice.
I said it once, and i'll say it again, just read and study the textbook like your grade depends on it and this course will be the easiest A you have ever received in your academic career.

Super boring class, with some interesting chapters from the textbook. Dr. Day is a really nice and accommodating prof, very knowledgeable too. Would take a class with him again, as this class fosters independent learning.

Day seems like a nice guy but his lectures are pretty dry and boring. Lectures and live meetings are not worth attending/watching, just make sure to understand the textbook fully. The tests and quizzes are worth 76 percent of your grade in total, and 2/8 quizzes and 1/4 tests are omitted. Very easy class overall that requires little effort.

Exams and quizzes were open book and based 99% on the textbook. 2/8 quizzes & 1/4 exams with the lowest score were omitted. A very nice prof but I stopped going to lectures because they were unnecessary and recorded. Only a couple of assignments and plenty of time to complete them. Overall, would take another class with him.
Worse prof ever. You have to get really deep into the textbook to earn marks in exams. Go check other profs on these psychology intro courses.

Took this class via remote learning and it was average. Stopped attending live lectures as they really did not help at all for quizzes or exams. READ THE TEXTBOOK!!!!! All quizzes are 100% based off textbook material so read the chapter and do the mind tap and you will be fine. 2 assignments were relatively easy and plenty of time to complete.

This course was completely self-taught. Everything in the textbook is fair game, and if you memorize that you're good to go. Quiz and exam questions can be tricky, but lowest mark for each is dropped. Did better on these when I stopped watching pre-recorded lectures and just focused more on the textbook. Live lectures are basically 30min Q&As.

He drops 2/8 quizzes and 1/4 exams (lowest marks) which is really nice! It's a pretty straight forward course. His "narrated shows" are short compared to other classes but he still talks pretty slow so I recommend listening in 1.75x speed. If you study the textbook and watch the lectures at the same time you're golden!

Dr. Day truly cares about his students, especially since he allows for 2 of 6 quizzes to be dropped as well as 1 of 4 term exams! Although his lectures were hard to follow sometimes since they could get long and boring, the textbook will keep you well informed. I highly suggest him as a prof!

I have heard this man talk 4 times max. All I did was study the textbook and I finished with an A in the course. Quizzes and exams were fair with various types of questions. Assignment was straight forward. Love that he drops the lowest exam and quiz marks. Memorization and applying concepts is crucial to succeed in this course!!

Lectures are useless, as long as you read and understand the textbook, you will do fine. He also drops 2 out of 8 quizzes and 1 out of 4 exams which is super nice if you don't understand a certain topic. Day was not much help at all as I taught the entire course to myself but the content is easy. Tests and quizzes combined are 84% of your grade

Dr Day is a great lecturer, even though he says "in terms of" at the end of his sentences. Some of the quiz/exam questions are ambiguous, try not to read too much into them. He gives lots of opportunities to make up marks by dropping lowest exam and quiz scores and giving bonus questions. Entertaining lectures.

Class was fair, especially considering COVID circumstances, he really did his best to accommodate the situation. Classes were important on days where there were iClicker quizzes, but overall test material focused on textbook readings.

He is a great professor. If you go to class and do the work, ask questions in office hours, you're golden. He was so genuinely caring and kind and explained things really well when I went to office hours. If you put in the work and show up to class, you will do well. He is really great at explaining concepts and an overall great teacher/human.

He was really, really good at giving practical and helpful lectures. Prepare to read lots though. Quizzes were highly easy, Midterms were a little difficult but doable to get A's consistently if you don't slack off.

Weekly quizzes and iClicker questions so class is essentially mandatory. Knows the lectures by heart and is clearly interested in the topics. I was never bored some other students didn't like him. Extremely organized, all quizzes are planned in advance and grading is as in the syllabus. No feedback on the assignment. The etext site is very helpful.
I literally taught myself this class. Read the textbook and take notes to pass the exams lol. Never showed up to lecture and got same mark as friend who showed up. At least there's no final.

Honestly not that bad, a lot of people complaining he has a lot of tests, but I think it's better because there's less material you need to study for the test. As long as you read the chapters and attend most of his classes you'll do fine on the exam. It's honestly not as bad as some people are saying it is

no point to go to class he just reads from the slides which is literally the textbook. only reason I went was for the bonus questions. super hard to get good grades on written part of exam with the average being 9/20. mc was hard too. no point to study you'll probably get the same mark if u guess.
Lectures are not helpful at all... a total of 8 iClicker quizzes and 4 exams.

It has too many works to get done U basically have exam once a week He said its assignment but its frickin term paper His lectures are worse ive ever had its no use for exams there are no information from book it is useless period.

This professor give so much work and has exams almost every other week. His assignments are basically term papers. He does give enough information in lectures but asks so much specific question in tests. the lectures are basically none existent because its of no use.
There is no point in showing up to lectures, you basically have to teach yourself this class.
tests are all textbook based.

PSYC102 He is a very interesting professor, he really tries to engage his audience. He uses a lot of questions from the textbook, so as long as you study the textbook, you wont really need to attend lectures, but I recommend going for clarification.

Decent prof. I didnt do the readings before class so I did not get much out of the lectures but he seems to be very passionate about what he does. Tough essay test portions but all doable when you put the work into it. lots of Iclicker quizzes, 4 term tests and a short project.

His lecture is useless you can find everything on textbook and his quiz and midterm are all about so details. The average I believe last semester was C cause he even changed the scale after the last exam.

Lectures aren't necessary, tests are on the tricky side. He is an ok lecturer but made a few inappropriate/creepy comments. The class overall is a lot of upkeep, and the new book is a lot harder to read than the old edition. I studied a lot but still barely passed most of the midterms. Other assignments help to grade boost. Class average was a C+
not a good choice for 100 lvl class
Russell Day is a great prof to have for psych. He is passionate, engaging, and funny. He clearly outlines criteria in class and don't expect to get perfect if you skip lectures.

His lectures are really boring but he tries to make it interesting. Really don't even need to come to class. Just show up for iclicker quizzes and exams. You're better off reading the textbook than attending his lectures. His exams have an MCQ part and an essay part. He usually tells you the essay part the class before so make sure to go that day.

Lectures are very boring and you do not need to attend class to pass. Focus mostly on the textbook because his lecture quiz and term exam questions are from there. His lecture slides are totally useless. He definetly expects way too much for a first year course. Content was not too hard to grasp, and is an easy A class.
You don't need to go to lecture but READ the textbook. Most multiple choice questions are example scenarios, essay question is really difficult. Boring prof and same with his lectures.

Lectures were dry and boring, as most of the material is ripped right out of the textbook. Russell tries his best to make the class entertaining, but fails as he goes on random tangents sometimes. Attend lectures for the iclicker quizzes, and read the textbook religiously. The average for the essay parts of the exam were really close to failure too

His class is not like other first year psych classes. It was difficult especially the written part for exams. Mcq questions r kind of tricky but it's pree easy if u study in detail. READ THE BOOK no need to go to the lecture. First long ans question was about designing a research study so study about it for the first exam. Be careful not easy.

You do not need to buy the textbook or go to the class because he uses the US version of the txtbook which is available online and has lectures online too incase you cant find something. Make sure for the written section, you put down literally everything related to the topic and atleast 1/2 sources to get a good mark.

Cant say too much when the first essay exam mean were 30% I think at least 20% ppl will fail this class because he never tell you what he expects on the essay Boring lecture with useless content which you can find on textbook anyways Just dont take it with him. If you take it then good luck with you

The class is literally the textbook. Just memeorize the textbook and you'll do fine, his lecture's are somewhat related but you don't need to study them at all, the entire test is based on the textbook. The essay answers are marked farily hard for a first year course.
All his exams and quizzes are purely on the textbook. Lectures are definitely not mandatory. Just take note while you read and study the night before. Easy A.
russell day is an awful teacher, lectures are the worst/most boring i have ever taken. Slides are bland and he makes no effort to engage students at all. Terrible teacher and terrible guy

Russell Day is a pretty good teacher. He is passionate about the material and his class was really interesting. There were 4 exams total which is kind of a lot but if you read the textbook chapters you will do well. The essay questions on the exams were really difficult so make sure you have an amazing ability to comprehend and apply material.
very boring lectures. if you do not go to the lectures but read the textbook and do the mindtap practice you will pass the course for sure
Rude and unclear about assignment guidelines, Russel is unhelpful and his lectured are useless.

There isn't a lot of clear guidelines to what is expected for the essay questions on the midterms. Went to his office hour and he makes you feel like you should't be asking questions if you are able to find the definitions in the textbook. He comes off as rude and arrogant.
Hes test was too much detail and the essay avg was 30% with no curve grading :( Hes lecture was useless because the most of exam are based on textbook.

The essay questions are marked incredibly hard. You have to meberozre the exact specfic deatils he wants you too to get a good mark. Its unfair for a first year class in my poion, I've taken higher level courses that require less deatiled answers. Other then that hes not too bad, he tests on the textbook, NOT lectures

makes psyc102 unnecessarily hard and the grading scheme is tough even though you drop a quiz 6/7 and a test 3/4 written sections are harshly marked - you have to memorize what he wants really have to get the concepts down would be better if class was curved would not take again too difficult for a 100 level course
Attendance is unnecessary, this course is 100% textbook based. Don't waste your time going to class, just memorize the textbook. Heavy but true.
he needs a lot of details for the essay answers

Professor Day is a really nice guy, if you have any questions you can always email him and he'll reply very quickly. Attendance isn't necessary, unless for iClicker quizzes/exams. However he does give tips to what will be on the exam. READ YOUR CHAPTERS BEFORE YOU GO TO CLASS, it will help in the long run. Go to listen to his lecture.

He is super entertaining and keeps lecture interesting. You can be successful in this class without attending lectures, except those where clicker quizzes or tests fall on. Make sure you read the text because lots of quiz content and test content correlate with chapter readings. Makes psych really interesting

The class might as well have been taken online. The lectures were not supplementary to the reading, which is whats most important. He went on tangents mentioning concepts that were not even relevant, so we'd just get confused. Grading is pretty hard. The essay questions always had a low average of just barely failing, or even failing. Q

Lectures were boring so I stopped attending. The lectures are recorded but all you need to do is memorize the textbook because more than half the stuff he says in class isn't on the exam. Four exams and 7 or so quizzes with the worst mark for both dropped. He isn't that bad but he wasn't my kind of prof. Good luck!
multiple choice questions are ridicious, all the answers are all possible/there is no exact one answer BEWARE

Really enjoyed this prof! 4 midterms not cumulative. No "surprise questions" on exams, basically read the textbook, memorize the concepts and ideas and youll do great. The lowest quiz mark as well as the lowest test mark is dropped PLUS additional 6% for research participation. He tries to make lectures fun and engaging.

Great experience. Buy the LaunchPad and textbook, do the launchpad questions and use quizlet to study. Easiest A+. 4 term exams (non cumulative) so just memorize the night before. 7 iclicker quizzes. Worst term exam and worst iclicker quiz mark gets dropped (very forgiving course). Easy A for sure! Prof is decent. But just read the textbook :)

Never take his class. Does not prepare you for any tests. Goes on random tangents every class that have nothing to do with the chapter and are usually about himself. His slides consists of 1 word points that aren't explained on why they're important. Expects students to do tests that are 70% lecture based even though his lectures are about himself.

Dr. Day is my favourite prof at SFU so far. He's super friendly and always makes his classes fun (which is actually pretty useful for remembering the lecture content later). All you need to do to ace this course is read the textbook chapters and do the LaunchPad quizzes. Grading is super clear and generous (he drops your worst exam AND quiz).
Straight forward. His lectures are interesting and relevant to psychology, but not always relevant to what we're studying particularly. Often goes on tangents.

His lectures are not related to exams. You have to read everything on the textbook. If you went his office hour, he just told you what textbook said. I got my lowest grade in this class. Launchpad is useful for quizzes.

Lectures are kind of pointless, as long as you read the textbook you are fine. However, he does occasionally drop hints for essay questions in class so attendance is beneficial. Easy class with 7 iclicker quizzes, 1 assignment, and 4 midterms. Lowest quiz and test dropped, so its easy to do well
Lectures were super bland and uninteresting. They just dragged on for what seemed like infinite amounts of time. Doesn't explain anything well, and is just repeating the textbook.

For an intro psych course with pretty general material, Russell did a good job of making lectures fun to attend. However, they do feel pretty pointless and he has a tendency to go on tangents that don't show up on tests. But the class had 4 midterms and no final so that was a good thing!

If you're the type of student that never wants to attend class but still needs the motivation to study then this class is perfect. Only attended classes with quizzes or exams which motivated me to study even though I went once every week or two. Iclicker quizzes are easy marks while the exams are trickier because of the written sections.
Don't need to show up for lectures. He just outlines everything that is already in the text, maybe elaborates a bit. Get launchpad and do quizzes for practice, and you have an easy A.

Lectures were definitely optional; I stopped attending unless quiz/test and I still received a great grade, just make sure to read the text closely. Made dry material as interesting as possible when I did attend lectures. TA marking was great and appropriate for an intro course. Very approachable guy overall; called me dear when I spoke to him :)

Day's lectures were long and painful. However, it is possible to get a good mark by reading the textbook. Very stressful course in that there was a test every 5 classes.  You don't need to attend lecture, just look at his slides online and then find the details in the textbook.

I give him props for trying to make the material interesting. Besides that: attending lectures not necessary unless exam/quiz day. There's lots to read (1 ch/wk), but quizzes help you stay on track. Tests are based off the text with essay/MC sections. Good guy, but not my type of prof.

Overall a good class. Reading the entire chapter that week and writing notes to study is how I began doing better. Self-study is more important than attendance. Only note of warning is the essay portion of exams are RIDICULOUSLY graded. I have failed 2/3 of them so far. Multiple choice itself is hard too.   no tutorial that's one plus

Seems like a pretty nice guy; he tried to make the lecture interesting. The lecture wasn't very helpful though, since you have to memorize everything in the book anyway. Test questions were pretty fair. He gives hints as to what the essay questions will be like. Overall, a pretty good choice for introductory psychology.
Lecture notes are not useful at all. Just memorize EVERYTHING in the textbook and you'll be fine. Tough grading on the essays though. Our class average for those was 50% or lower.

Office hours are a joke. Any question slightly harder than basic comprehension will get you the vaguest answer, leaving you wondering why you are paying money for profs who don't know the content. He often has to look up the answers for even the basic questions. I understand why he always wants us to see TAs. Coursework is fine; prof not so much.

Course content itself is manageable but I did not enjoy the class because the prof himself is not very helpful. Doesn't know the material enough to answer his own test questions. Foists off all the work on the poor TAs. I did very well, but not due to this prof. I found him to be kind of rude and judgemental, really old fashioned. Not recommended.

I've had better lecturers who knew their stuff a lot more than he did.   I once asked if I could see my recent midterm, because he holds the ones for disabled students, but he called me "obsessive" for wanting to. Rude.  Not approachable or encouraging to students keen to learn more & doesn't know how to do his own test questions. Not recommended.

Need a B-Soc that is both interesting and straightforward? Psyc is probably for you! Day is an amazing lecturer! Even if you have 2 hour lectures, he manages to make the topics seem very interesting and relatable. Slides are given and note taking is a breeze. Bi-weekly quizzes & 4 midterms + short cumulative. Read the text and you're good to go.
Prof is mean
Long lectures, but he's easy to listen to. Makes jokes and uses videos often. His tests are made up mostly of things from the textbook.

Good Proff, engaging throughout lecture. Lots of information to memorize. Using launchpad to read the textbook and taking practice tests were very useful for the iclicker quizzes. The essay portion of the exams are tricky, but just write down as many relevant points as possible. For the assignment, be sure to have enough time for research.

Exams are hard, but the final is all multiple choice worth 40% of your grade. He is by far the greatest prof i've ever had. He makes the lectures very interesting and uses many examples to pull aside from the textbook. Textbook is mandatory. iclicker quizzes are fair if you read the textbook. All and all, great professor.

Great professor, keeps you engaged in lectures with i-clicker questions, videos etc. Very helpful and easy to talk to. The course requires a lot of reading ( 1 ch. per week), there is often either a quiz or test every week so keeping up with the material is essential. Essay questions are hard to do well on, average was 50%. Very interesting course!

Great prof. Lectures are interesting and engaging. He drops your lowest quiztest which is awesome. Expect to read 30-40 pages per week. The essay part can be tricky. We had to write essays for 3 of our exams and the average for the essay portion was slightly over 50%. Definitely expect to put effort in. I ended up with an A.

Russell Day is a great prof. He knows what he's talking about, inside and out. Recommend him as a prof. I had him for Psych 100 and I look forward to taking future Psychology courses with him! The slideshows for his lectures are also posted online, which is a huge plus. Make sure you read the textbook!
Nothing he tests on was from his actual lecture slides (which are based on another older textbook for some reason). Just read the textbook and you'll do fine.
Gave incorrect information about a psych condition I actually have; argued with me when I corrected him, told me 'well, you should know all about inaccurately stereotyped symptom.'
Terrible prof. Lectures were useless. Just read the textbook and you should be fine.

Material was interesting but the class was boring. Multiple choice questions are rather easy but essays are ridiculously hard to get a good grade on. The averages of the essay question are approximately 50%. I'd recommend taking this class with another professor if possible.
Material isn't that hard but exams are ridiculously tough. The essays are extremely tough. Definitely not the best Psychology prof out there as I've had better Psychology profs.
Very funny lecturer that makes going to class worth it even though the audio can be found online. Tests and quizzes are straightforward and questions are based on the textbook readings.

Great lecture prof but terrible exams.  Essays that are impossible to score perfect on and easy mc. If you are unhappy with your essay go and get it regraded.... my friend got hers regraded and went from a C+ to a A-. They don't really have a marking scheme for the essays only if they are better or worse than the average essay they get.

Day is an awesome prof! Interesting lecture and never boring. Material can be dry but makes it interacting. 1 chapter reading per week and iclicker after every chapter. Written part of midterm can be tricky with time managing, MCQ are very situational. Would not recommend taking both 100102 together with this prof due to heavy reading.

Hes a good teacher, lectures were helpful in the beginning than got progressively less useful. If you read the textbook and do the launchpad questions you are set to go. Lots of reading for sure. But if you work relatively hard an A at least, is not hard to get.

It is quite a bit of work like you would expect from any introductory course, but material is straight-forward and interesting. Readings are long so keep up, but the content itself is not difficult. Most of the bad reviews are probably from people who didn't try hard enough and ended up with low marks. Put in the effort and you'll be fine!

Excellent class. He sets you up to do well and gives you everything you need to achieve a good mark. If you find yourself with a low mark at the end of the semester, it is your fault. Tests are fair, and he posts all of his notesrecordings. he lets you know exactly what to study for the exams. Weekly quizzes are a nice gpa boost. Would take again

Format was 7 i-clicker quizzes and 4 term exams. We were graced with the opportunity of omitting our worst quiz and term exam. Quizzes were very straightforward, exams were a little tougher. Read the textbook to do well on MC, know how to critically apply and relate the material to do well on the written portion. Textbook  Lectures.

A good majority of the lectures are not mandatory to attend, bc IClicker quizzes and exams usually revolve around the tb. LOTS of information to read over. (especially if you are taking this alongside PSYC100)

Great lecturer, keeps us all engaged. Lots of quizzes and midterms but they're easy enough if you read the textbook (which is a must since he bases the entire course off of it) His lectures aren't really that important if you read the textbook though, so don't worry about skipping now and then (or all the time)

Hardly anyone shows up to lecture its really optional. Several quizzes extremely easy and straight forward. Only hard part is the essays on the midterms and he drops big hints about what they're going to be so you can prepare for them. No surprised read the textbook listen to lectures and you're good to go, super fun class for me!
Lecturespowerpoints were useless. Reading the textbook is a must.

Lectures aren't mandatory I never went to them unless there was a iclicker quiz (out of 10 and questions are straight from the textbook) or a midterm. Midterms mc questions are straightforward the essay is tough! Basically read the textbook and be good at memorizing. If you got those two things down this class is pretty darn straight forward!

This course requires heavy constant reading. You'll have to read like 5 pages everyday to do well in this course. Exams are somewhat fair. 48 multiple choice questions and an essay. The written part was VERY hard, not many people finished it on time. There are research programs that you'll have to make an extra appointment and participate.

Amazing Prof, clear, easy to understand, passionate, didn't put me to sleep. Tough class though, mc questions are mostly situational and applying what you learned. Short answers were the toughest part.

I took an intersession course with him, so 3 times a week. There were 4 term exams, a bunch of iClicker quizzes and an assignment. Honestly, I'm sure I could have achieved an A if I really tried, but I managed to get a B+ with minimal effort (in my opinion, it was minimal - I did the readings but slacked). Didn't do so well on quizzes. STUDY.

Dr Days grading scale is what really messed me over in this course. I got 80 in the course and got B on transcript, w/o any scalling. Important to mention that he has many many tests, quizzes etc. For the amount of work you put into the course, you wouldnt get the grade you deserve. If you have to take a course with him, do so, otherwise avoid him.

Dr. Day is wonderful! He is approachable and he makes lectures informative and interesting. :) The course has a lot of information so you have to keep up with the material.  Read the textbook (iclicker quizzes are based on textbook material)! Exams are fair though the written portion can get tricky.
Very hard exams. Emotionally and physically draining course.
Amazing professor; awesome course. Informative and simple
Textbook based, seriously. Midterms were fair, though the essay questions are a bit hard. 90 MC for final.

Horrible grading and percentage ranking! Especially midterm, essay question is not expecting, multiple choice is like reading question. No way!!!! I spend so much time in reading his text, and it is horrible.

Interesting prof, passionate about the material. Exams have essays which kind of screw you over, make sure to read the assigned articles. The MC is easy. Overall the course is alright, not a GPA booster if not interested in psychology
Interesting Proffessor.

Psych 100 = class I've ever had the misfortune of taking. I am currently 8% away from failing this god-awful horror show of a course. If you have ever had one of those nightmares where you take an exam and none of the words make sense, just know that those nightmares are the equivalent of kittens and butterflies. Day is a sweet dude, but run. Far.

I took both introductory courses with Dr. Day. I would strongly recommend against this though. I had to drop PHIL100 because I had no time for anything but psyc. Attendance isn't mandatory unless you have a quiz or exam. Overall, the courses are based off the textbook.

I do not recommend him. The workload is extremely unreasonable.  Be warned!  Do not take both introductory Psych classes from him in the same semester.  You will not have time for your other classes.  Very nice man, but way too many quizzes, assignments, and exams.
Not bad. But you seriously have to read the textbook

very straightforward, very clear on what's expected.. however.. there's sooo many readings! it gets hard to keep up with all the textbook readings, quizzes and midterms.... the essay questions on the midterms are SUPER hard to get a good mark on, but the MC is always pretty easy. keep up with the readings and you'll be fine

MY FIRST AAAAAAAAAAAAAA I'M SO HAPPY but seriously study don't cram everything the night before the final, you need 50% on the final to pass the course for psych 102...other than that you'll do great WOOOHOOOOOOO CHRISTMAS TIME BABY

Nice Prof, you definitely need to read the text; lecture is kind of helpful. Essays questions are hard, but if you study hard you will get what you expected. Overall very fair marking and exams, recommended.

Dr Day is actually a really nice prof! The only thing that I dislike is his lecture notes are no help! Everything is based on textbook! Midterm consists of 30 mc and 2 essays and 90 mc for final! Despite his teaching style, he is a really nice person :) !

Can't decide whether or not I like him. Pros: VERY organized, clear, and pretty fair overall. Cons: Sometimes words questions in an unfavourable way, iClicker quizzes are kind of hard, midterm essay questions marked extremely hard. Very important to read the textbook in this course, as quizzes and midterms are based almost entirely on text

Great prof, loved his class. It's a very interesting course. Essays on midterms are marked quite hard but the final brings up the mark. Heavily textbook based course. He keeps his lectures interesting.

Excellent prof! Interesting lectures, but only add background knowledge to the concepts. Study the textbook as everything is based off this. Marks the essays pretty roughly. It's possible to get a great grade in this course, but you need to treat it like a science instead of an easy 100 level course.

I think he genuinely wants his students to succeed. He loves what he does. but beware of the midterms.. the essays are really tough and marked really tough as well, but the final brings up everyones' grade :) don't leave the assignment till the last minute either.. I recommend this class

The clicker questions are not easy, they're scenarios and then you have to decide which theory it is referring to. If you're a person who usually just likes to study the powerpoint slides and not the textbook, tough luck because his slides contain no info. You'll only get a good mark if you really take the time to read every detail in the textbook.

PSYC is not an easy, wishy washy course. It's a science, and should be studied with similar rigor. My only explanation for the negative ratings is that these students obviously did not try very hard in the course itself. Russell Day is an excellent prof, very funny and obviously passionate about his subject. Just do your readings, and take notes.
Read the textbook lectures are useless and midterms are super hard
Essays are marked too hard and thoroughly, taking into account the small amount of time one has to write them.

he tries to be funny but it doesn't work. his lectures are useless, don't even bother going to class, it's a complete waste of time.just read the textbook and know the material inside out. multiple choice questions are usually fair but the essay questions on exams are super hard,the TA's mark hard except carlos is usually a fair marker.
VALUE he says value a lot

Really nice and easy to talk to especially if you go see him during office hours. His lecture notes are completely useless... and the long answers on his midterm exams are brutal!! Just memorize the entire textbook - no need to attend his lectures
DO NOT RECOMMEND AT ALL,,I don't know what he is taking about during lecture. His voice just makes me want to sleep!! MTs are nightmares,,, He talks about topics that are irrelevant,,
His power points were useless. always take about stuff that is not related to class. midterms and finals are hard and seems like you never heard of that topic before cause he never eve mention it!

This class is a nightmare! The exams are ridiculous: two essays and 30 multiple choice in 80 min! No time to write, even if you know all the material! The TAs do not read all the essays and just give you a low mark for no reason. And they have just one office hour/week for 130 students! You can't even talk to the TA! Do not take!

I was expecting a GPA booster, because, well, it's psych, but NOOO. He has to word questions ambiguously so you don't even know what he's asking. You have 80' to complete 2 essays and 30 MC.  I would study at least 20 hours for each MT and rewrote all the chapters, but the TA's marked super hard.

His lectures are useless because he will give you a bare bones explanation. Go if you have a quiz/midterm otherwise it is a waste of time. You pretty much pay 500 to teach yourself! The text will be your best friend in this class so read it! Lucky for you the material unlike him is actually really interesting. Good luck!

DO NOT TAKE. So much more difficult than other professors. No time at all to do the midterms essays when the MC requires critical/analytical thinking. Too many iClicker quizzes. I would definitely not recommend this professor although he is a somewhat humorous guy.
Very friendly and approachable during office hours! Amazing lecturer and managed to keep my attention 24/7 in a 2 hour lecture! Only hard part are his essay questions...not enough time...
he explains very thoroughly

I found the course very useful. Pay attention, study, and you'll find subsequent psyc courses so much easier. I printed out his slides posted on webct, listened, took notes, read a few case studies from the textbook and found it sufficient. Exams were quite hard, but if you review the material before you take them, you shouldn't have a problem.

EVERYTHING heavily relies on the textbook. I worked my butt off and the class avg for most midterms was 55%.Some midterm questions were based on certain facts that can be missed so read EVERYTHING. If you think "he wont", he WILL put it on the exam. Classes mandatory for iclicker quiz days but I didn't show up for useless regular days
If you hate to memorize stuff, don't take the course. Just read the whole textbook and only show up for quizes and tests.
Exams are difficult, not enough time to complete them. Lectures are pointless to go to. Basically, have to memorize all the info in the textbook. Would not recommend this prof.
Midterms are hard especially essay portions, iClicker quizzes are fair as long as you do the readings. Final is all MC which helps boost your mark. Interesting course but not an easy A (or even B)

GOOD: extremely strong lecturer/speaker. he knows exactly what hes talking about, and makes lectures so interesting that u dont wanna miss. BAD: a lot of work! be prepared to study every week, u have to bc quizzes. LONG chapters. its not hard, its just A TON of material to grasp in short time and lots of studying..lots of reading
quizzez are ok,but his midterms are really tough, epesically the essay parts.Also, boring unless lectures since all his exams are out of the book.i would reccomend taking with this prof,

His lectures are really intriguing. Some concepts that you won't be able to understand by the book, he will make it easy to grasp during his lectures. The only difficult part is the essay questions he ask in his mid-terms.

Everyone here says if you read the textbook you'll be fine, which is true. BUT reading the textbook is such a pain! tiny little font and chapters are so long, wish i knew this before. Took this as an elective and ended up spending ALL my time on this course. Essay questions are hard. DO NOT TAKE if you don't have to, trust me.

Very tough course! Lots of content and GOOD LUCK on the essay portion of exams - they're marked very hard. Seems like a nice guy but comes across a little condescending. Interesting content, but lots of reading and you HAVE to keep up with it. iClicker tests are fair.
Very informative course relied heavily on the textbook. Attending lecture is not so much helpful except to do i-clicker quizzes.

Really enjoyed his class. Thought he was a good speaker, really helpful. The exams are hard, especially the essay parts. Quizes weren't too bad, they helped to know what to study for the exam. Do all the readings and take good notes. Overall, good prof.

Hillarious guy!! I thoroughly enjoyed all his classes. I could have done better in his class if I hadn't slacked off with my readings. DO ALL YOUR READINGS ON TIME and try to understand the content rather than just reading it and you'll easily ace the course! Definitely reccomend it!
Quizs are ok yet exams are really hard. Have to write two essays and the topics are hard and broad.

Just do all the online questions and you'll be fine.  He's an interesting guy.  I found he was a fair marker for all except the assignment which didn't really make sense.  Mickey Mouse course for sure.

Really enjoyable.  Applies psychology topics to real life.  Must buy and read the textbook.  Quizzes (i-clicker) are on the text, exams are on lectures and text.  Assignments aren't the greatest but if you follow directions and study, its really not hard to do well in his class!

If it's available with Alder, take it with Alder. Day teaches the exact same course with similar slides and similar exams, but Alder explains things much more quickly and sticks to the important points. Day's lectures are slow and covers the very obvious sections. Also, more essays on exams makes it harder than Alders for a good mark.

Thought he was an awesome prof, very entertaining. Psyc 100 definitely isn't an easy walk in the park class. There is a lot of work, but it is do-able. The marking of the written sections on the last two midterms were brutal- so maybe try to better on the first one? #1 THING- READ THAT TEXTBOOK

Russell is a great speaker. Though lectures are not mandatory for success in the course, lectures are very entertaining and worth the time. Make sure you read the textbook thoroughly and you'll do great in the course. Russell was very open to providing help during office hours. Great course overall.

No point in going to lecture, besides the tests/quizzes (all from textbook). Midterms' written component marked ridiculously hard, and the assignment was very unclear. Prof is not very approachable, even if you just email, he gives off the attitude you're just wasting his time.

Dreadfully boring. Lectures are poorly regurgitated material from the textbook, and he spent far too much time fretting over administrative nonsense rather than teaching what little content he did. You could pass this course without showing up once; it's all in the textbook.

The class is not very interesting, but if you read the textbook (actually READ it) the class is very easy. iClicker quizzes are on info from text, midterm is mostly textbook stuff also. Beware... he likes to frighten his class suddenly sometimes.
Excellent speaker. Knows what he talks about. Class is straight forward and interesting for most chapters. Keep up with readings cuz quizzes are from the book.

Professor Day is an absolute delight. He is very enthusiastic about the material and a joy to listen to. His lectures don't do much to help with the quizzes and exams, though, so just study the book and you'll be fine.
He's a bit boring but very clear. Lectures can get boring too, but as long as you keep up with readings and do well on i-clicker quizzes, you're set. Seems like a nice guy though
Way too much work for a 100 level course. The quizzes are much easier than the exams. Class was interesting but make sure you keep up with reading because his lecture notes were useless.

Great professor. The workload was pretty heavy for a 100 level course, but if you put  in the time and do the work, it really pays off for exams and such. He is an entertaining professor, really enjoyed his classes!

Great intro psych course. Lectures were interesting but not always relevant to the quizzes/exams. What's most important is to read and understand the textbook. Do the I-Clicker quizzes. Professor Day can be intimidating in person so if you have questions, ask your TM.

Lectures are absolutely useless as everything comes from the textbook, russel is a boring lecturer, trys to be cool by wearing an eating and plays music before class sometimes. ESSAY Q'S ON MIDTERMS ARE MARKED RIDICULOSLY UNFAIR, mc is tough but fair, if you read the book you should do alrite.
Nice guy, although can be difficult to approach if you have a question. He can reply to you in a very sarcastic, condescending way. Exams for the most part were fair, as are this quizzes.
he's awesome! although he talks most talks about what's in the text, he makes the material much more interesting. Also, he treats all students 100% equally.

Took this course last term. He was really boring in class. No need to listen to his lectures. It was pure reading off the textbook for this course. I-clicker questions are reasonable. Rude when I approached him to ask him a question.
Worst prof ever!So much homework to do.Not kind to students.NEVER take his class!!

Worse prof ever! who ever says they like him r crzy! he mocks you when you ask him a question. His TA are even worse they give marks out of no where and they just want to get rid of you as fast as possible and when you set up a appointment with them they don't even show up or if they do they want to leave as soon as possible. take a diff prof for i

he`s extremely energetic and tries really hard to keep you interested.  quizzes and midterms and final were fair. it might`ve seem like a lot of work but it FORCED us to keep up with everything that needed to be learned.  In the end, we were prepared for the final and had actually learned throughout the term.
Prof. is funny and nice guy. However, materials are little bit harder than i expected. There are 3 midterms, 1 finals, and 8 quizzes..too much works for 1st year student.

Tons of work for a first year course. Lotta memorization and small quizzes. Upside is you get to choose 6/8 iclicker quiz marks and 2/3 midterm marks. Final was a cakewalk mc if you studied for the iclicker quizzes and midterms throughout the course. I hated him as a professor though. All in all, fair class, but IMO, a bit much for a first-year

In general, this course is a HEAVY workload course, with quizzes every week, 3 midterms, an essay, and research participation!  However, hard work definitely pays off in this class!  This course is recommended for students who are amazing at memorization of terms and concepts.  If not, (and it isn't a requirement) dont take it.
Good prof who get's the material across quite well.  Assigns too much reading though if you ask me.  Pretty funny too!

So much reading and work for a first-year course IMO. Exams with an essay portion do not give enough time to complete it. The average for essays are between 40-60%, yes, a fail average. Overall not a BAD teacher but he isn't very helpful. Sympathizes with students but does little about it. Quiz on the last day of class? Seriously? Bonus: bellcurved

Before when I didn't read the textbooks, I thought the course was really difficult. But when I actually READ the textbooks before quizzes and tests (like, just once), it was a breeze. Well, multiple choice questions are. Essays are extremely difficult. MT Essay class avg: 1) 9/30 2) 11/30. It's ridiculous.
well, he is a great prof, but he exams are very hard. and he has quizes for every single chapters. and the answers are tricky

If you can take psych w/ another prof, do so. Day will just create headaches. Worst/Hardest prof I've had so far. This course is HEAVY reading. Days tests are also difficult, he words his Qs very abstract (If Pat had fear of Pizza...)and you will find you get them wrong even though you know the material.He wont answer/help w/ easy questions either.

Awesome Prof. Great teaching style, balanced class, and good motivation to keep up with your work. People complain about all the quizzes and midterms, but I prefer it that way since it spreads out the weight of the grades.
Funny prof. Talks about jokes more than the lectures. He marks very hard on essays and make sure you read the textbook.
If you read the book and take notes, it's not hard to get an A  in this subject. He was very helpful and passionate!

Boring!  I had him for PSYC 100 and found him to be somewhat interesting; however, his teaching style gets so repetitive and uninteresting.  Plus, if you ever realize that he uses "Etc. Etc." way too often, usually when it doesn't apply, you will never be able to regain focus.
Classes are enjoyable, funny. Good prof. Main focus is on the Textbook. read the chapters and get atleast a B. Open lab quizes very easy. Overall, best prof ive had so far :)

His teachings are alright, but he's kinda hard to get along with well. His multiple choice is really hard. He doesn't finish lecturing before he gives quizes. Some of his TAs are bad = losing marks for stupid things. personally I didn't enjoy talking with him or anything. I love the class, not the prof.
Awesome prof!
Good prof, bad TA's. Lose marks for having wrong font on a paper, etc...
Best prof I have ever had!

I love this prof! Funny, easy going and very clear. If only the classes weren't so huge! His TAs, watchout, they don't mark very well. The written part of the exams, you should ask him in person on how he wants it done, it took me while to figure outhe was looking for (its not always about what you know).
A fun teacher who keeps the class interesting, and is always ready to help a student.
Fun class, fun prof, but the quizzes and exams were based on the textbook, so attendance to lecture is purely optional. Fairly easy, you just need to read the text.
Excellent prof! Very funny, and helpful, and the course is interesting as well. Read the textbook and memorize as much as possible, a lot of multiple choice. Reading ahead will be useful
the lectures were fun but he just briefs through the chapters. mostly you just concentrate on reading the textbooks and the open labs were easy marks as long as you read it.

Not one lecture went by where he didn't have the entire lecture hall laughing. Funny guy who's able to make psychology fun. He cares for his students. When so many people missed their quizzes, he was willing to stay after class and have a lab open and let them do it. Quizzes are based on textual information, tests are conceptual comprehension.

Nice prof. Lectures interesting but not useful for quizzes or exams. I found the quizzes were too picky on details. Hard to get a good grade even after reading the chapter multiple times. Midterms and final were a bit better.
He is overall a good proof....study and read ahead will be great!But then i think the final exam were too tricky for most of the questions...

Overall a pretty good prof, well-known for his blue shirts, music before lecture and mini-demos in class. Textbook reading is CRUCIAL for this course! It's a good idea to make notes or cue cards and to try to stay ahead on the reading. Final exam was all multiple choice and relatively easy =)

Just an amazing teacher that makes Intro to Psych an easy going and fun look into some basic elements of the brain and human behavior. His Exams and quizzes are straight out of the textbook, His classes just revise and add some interesting points/current views/research to the topics being studied.

Pretty cool prof, very passionate about the things that he teach. always makes funny and corny jokes and we listend to disturbia before class! the only bad thing is, lots of textbook reading and memorizing terms. CLASS is NOT mandatory :)

A well-organized and well-run 1st year class.  Exams are fair.  Lectures are interesting/entertaining, but ultimately next to useless in preparing you for exams, which there are a lot of, plus quizzes.  Read the book, understand the concepts (not difficult), and memorize the bolded terms!  Material isn't hard but requires work (reading.)
A fun prof, obvious that he loves teaching. Taking him again for 102. :)
Good prof overall! His lectures are somewhat useful,but not for me at least because i read the book instead of listening to what he saids in class. Thus, attending to this class in not mandatory.

If you're taking this class for a higher GPA, I wouldn't. Lot's of reading. But, the prof is fun and interesting, he's really cool. Just read the textbook and memorize. The questions on the tests are asked in a way where he gives you a situation and have to choose the best word that would describe the situation.
He is very funny and makes psychology very interesting.

he's hard.. at least harder than i thought. his exams are really into little details. requires lots of memorization + application.. also, i took this course for elective and i didn't really need it and i end up studying more for this course than my other courses.. when i ask him some questions, he didn't really give enough help or answer....
tests are very hard.  he is a nice guy, very approachable.  Tends to waste a lot of time at the beginning of the lecture talking about things which aren't related to psyc
Awesome prof, you can tell he is passionate about teaching. Expects a lot from students and is very helpful. He is also super funny and plays Queen at the beginning of every lecture - its great!

Had really high expectations for this class when i signed up for it- but was totally let down. this class and the prof are OVERRATED. static and just downright boring at times, I wouldnt recommend taking this class. i worked really really hard and got an A minus, but this was supposed to be a gpa booster- hardly. memorize memorize memorize!!!
SERIOUSLY such a good prof! loved him!
Great prof!
Great Professor! He uses great examples to demonstrate psychological points which makes them much more salient. His lectures are interesting so make sure you go!
No Comments
His classes are useless. You must read the text.

for this class, the notes are not indepth so to do well, READ THE TEXT again and again and also understand the bolded terms in the textbook...the short answer parts of midterms were tough(hint: define and explain everything and write lots).. prof gives some good examples to understand concepts..the material itself is interesting
I wish I could in his class again
Dr. Day is great! The first test was hard, then it gets easier. He makes the lectures real fun. Lots of examples. Loved the class loved him.

As a first year student, this class was a gift! The prof is a really nice guy that is very easy to talk to. I could definitely tell he was passionate about helping students and making the course enjoyable. THE KEY TO GETTING AN A+ IN THE CLASS: memorize, memorize and memorize the text book.
Great Professor. I enjoyed attending lectures, he briefly goes over textbook sections. If you get to class early enough you can bring in music for him to play...

This class is dead easy. Lectures were a complete waste of my time; I stopped attending halfway through the semester, and still got an A+ for the course. However, you absolutely MUST read the textbook, he examines straight out of it, if you went off the class notes alone you'd be screwed. My advice: memorize the bold words in your textbook.

Very interesting lectures! He includes little questionnaires and surveys that enhance his lectures. 3/4 exams count towards the grade, one paper, and one group presentation. Class was moderately easy if you read the textbook.
Good prof

I took PSYC 100 and 102 with him. Very nice and approachable guy, also very interested in the subject. He treats everyone like an elementary kid in lectures. His exams (written part) is based on his lecture notes, however the Multiple Choice you really have to read every page of the chapter in the the text book. I would recommend it.
not bad guy

Good at lecturing. Exams are somewhat tough since you have to apply the knowledge rather than regurgitate, but his teaching style is easy to follow and not too dry. Definitely the guy you want if you're taking psyc 100.
Really great prof.... attending lectures makes everything alot more clear than it is in the text. Fair workload... tough exams, more understanding and applying info than memorizing!

Didn't like his lecture style at all - treats students like we're in elementary school!  Until the exams, that is - very hard!  Sounds like others like his style, but if you don't like being talked down to, avoid his class.  Also, he only covers a fraction of what's on the exams in his lectures.
He makes class really interesting
great guy; not too strict but not too lenient either; learned A LOT; lectures are never boring even if the topics are
Interesting lectures, but lots of work for this class (group projects, papers). Exams are fair game.
He is a good prof. Helps alot. Thx
Don't underestimate the workload!! He's funny and pretty good but way too hard for a 100 level class..

The material...kinda hectic and a workload! But the Prof!?!?!?! FAULTLESS!!!!!!!!!!! His lectures were one of the few where i actually wasn't interested in listening online at all. COme hell or high water...i had to go and see what he'd do. If you get the chance...GO FOR IT!

Nice person to talk to one on one, but I didn't like his lecture style.  He narrowed the focus with his notes, but then you still had to read the textbook in order to do well on the exam.  Exams were ok if you studied.  His marking style for the essay questions was confusing, but if you pay attention to your mistakes, you can improve.

the class? not as easy as one thinks.  the prof?  ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC.  funny, informative, and concise.  can command a class of 400 effortlessly and makes it seem like he's just having a convo with you.  if you are interested in psyc and day's teaching it...DON'T HESITATE!
Lovely, hillarious guy! The lectures and course content are great, but the exams are ball breakers even if you've taken other psych courses!!! Labs are great too!
Amazing lectures, very funny and interesting.  He has a way of making students interested, and getting them involved.  I especially enjoyed his class on hypnotism; it was hilarious!  Great Prof!

This prof is a riot. He's funny, interesting, etc. However - 100 level psyc classes will MURDER you on the exams. I think this is their secret way of filtering out all the students from going on to upper level Psyc. Whatever the reason - its pretty stupid considering the money we pay for this.

I personally find the content interesting but when it comes to the midterms I freak out.  His lectures are easy to follow and the content in the book is relatively easy as well.  But the midterms are hideous!  The M/C is reasonable....sometimes, but the essay portion is difficult.  His expectations are way too high.

Exams (multiple choice and essay) are extremely hard. Way too much stuff to memorize. If you read the text properly you can do well. His lectures were all over the place. I ignored his lectures and read the text and did well. He's a funny guy, sometimes hes boring. 102's material is better than 100's.
Found him condescending, rude, and childish on class.  Everything that came out of his mouth mad me cringe for some reason.  Fairly helpful one on one though.  Overall not a good prof in my opinion.
hard test especially on mutiples choices, a lot of memorization in order to do well
Really good prof.
Interesting Prof, though lectures weren't very necessary for midterms/final.  The course had a lot of components, though with effort they could be successfuly completed.

I hated the way Day taught the class. His lectures were really boring and not helpful. I will never take another class with him, I learned everything on my own anyways. The marking for the long answer midterm questions was unfair. The finals (both for 100 and 102) were also really hard.
funny, dont make u fall asleep..but must must MUST read the text book..exams comes more from text then notes
He was great, what more can I say. He was clear, answered questions and the work load was fine. Great prof and great course.
Hard prof. He was great at first unitl he made me cry.
his lectures were pretty interesting..but there's quite a bit to do in the course
Great prof. yeah a bit high school like but so what? Nice guy to talk to. One of the few classes that can keep me awake.

Dr. Day is a great prof. The lectures are fun, and cover a decent amount of material. The material could relate a bit more to the tests, you can definatly afford to miss lectures if need be. good Psyc prof, with hard hard tests.

You don't learn anything from him. He makes dumb jokes. He spent so long to lecture on a topic but less valuable information is given. Very often you see students sleeping, playing games on their laptops or leaving early.
Good stuff

What is with all the smiley faces. Ok yeah, he is pretty easy and clear, but he is sooo annoying. i cannot stand him. At least everything is in the textbook and I don't have to go to lecture. The worst teacher I have ever had. Way too high school.
Definitely my favorite prof and perfect for a first year course.  His lectures are organized, structured and he knows how to keep the class entertained.  Quite funny!

Very hard course, but Dr Day makes it so enjoyable and worth your efforts. amazing guy if you go and have a chat with him. Very personable and genuinely interested to know you as a person. Would recommend him as a prof any day.
very interesting

this dude here is the most AWESOME dude u can haf as a prof, every class is like a partay and he involves everyone in his lectures.  he makes it fun and interesting so that lectures are not 50mins of bs with earning nth!!!  haf not had a better prof
No Comments
Fun and interesting class, makes readings for the class more interesting as well. What else can i say?
good prof. and what else can i say?
He is an ok professor, but he explains very good. his exams are not easy though

He makes the lecture interesting! He gives fair exams but the essay section is being marked too hard! One should never expect a "PSYC 100" student capable of writing something possible to contribute to psychology. Materials in this course is ove

Very engaging prof.  Makes lectures interesting to listen to, I always looked forward to them.  Material taught is also very interesting, but amount of information can be overwhelming.  Don't fall behind in your readings in this class.
Boring and useless.  Stop talking about webCT and start talking about what you're supposed to be teaching.  No depth, no interesting stories or comments.  Really disappointing.
Fun and engagine prof.  overall not a hard course, i put in little effort and still manage to get a B..
Excellent prof. He is funny, compassionate and truely cares about his students. Is able to teach the broad topics covered in this course in appropriate detail.
he tries his best to make the class interactive, very nice and approachable guy. i found him boring despite this, but overall awsome prof.
excellent, logical teaching. Took 100 and 102 at the same time, got a C in 100 from a useless prof, and an A- in 102 from Day. Gotta be the teaching.
Very accessable for extra help, and taught with an ease that made his lectures more interesting.  He was also very attentive to student's reactions during lecture.

Extremely good prof. His lectures are well organized and informative. The exams are fair and you'll do fine as long as you keep up with the readings. I found the marking scheme on the assignments to be pretty generous.
He makes jokes all the time and manages his lectures well.  He spends time explaining the important stuff and skims over the rest that's in the text.  Exams are very fair.

funny prof, nice to talk to about any issues concerning the course....however, too much info required to know for the test (ie. textbook AND supplementary material), marking is a little bit too hard...in general, good prof
Wonderful professor.
i thought he was very approachable and mad the class interesting.  I also thought his exams were tough but fair

Even the lectures are interesting.  His expectation for first and second year students are way too high..Huge ego and doesn't seem to like give good marks to students, appear to be friendly but not from bottom of his heart.
dont like him.. once gave us a midterm in psyc 100 or 102 the day after Halloween. dont like how he swears in lecture either. it's inappropriate
I hated him! Thought he was witty and funny and made a few immature comments to "lighten up" the class. But he's really organized with his lectures and keeps his webct info up to date.
His lectures are interesting but he marks pretty strict on his papaers. Lots of things to memorize so be prepared to do that within a short time. Nice prof.
Great prof, funny and v.easy to follow.
funny dude, very understanding, course content so-so.
